title: [Large-Scale] Digital Game-Based Elementary Mathematics Learning Design: Language Integration Approach

context.prior_knowledge: Proficiency in basic arithmetic operations and mathematical concepts, recognition of elementary-level math terminology (fractions, decimals, operational symbols)
context.additional_context: Reducing math anxiety, enhancing engagement, and strengthening mathematical text comprehension through individual digital device usage and game-based learning.

learning_goals: Learners reduce anxiety by 20% by accurately understanding linguistic expressions (problem statements, instructions) during mathematical problem-solving in DGBL environments.
Learners solve text-based in-game problems (fraction/decimal operations) with ≥85% accuracy and acquire mathematical vocabulary and conceptual expressions.
Learners identify ≥3 error patterns (calculation·linguistic misunderstandings) through learning log analysis and improve mathematical expression and problem-solving strategies.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
